claim(uint256,address,uint128,bytes32[]).details: Emits a {Claim} event. Requirements: - The campaign must not have expired. - The stream must not have been claimed already. - The Merkle proof must be valid.

params.amount: The amount of ERC-20 assets to be distributed via the claimed stream.
params.index: The index of the recipient in the Merkle tree.
params.merkleProof: The proof of inclusion in the Merkle tree.
params.recipient: The address of the stream holder.

returns.streamId: The id of the newly created stream.

clawback(address,uint128).details: Emits a {Clawback} event. Requirements: - The caller must be the admin. - No claim must be made, OR   The current timestamp must not exceed 7 days after the first claim, OR   The campaign must be expired.

params.amount: The amount of tokens to claw back.
params.to: The address to receive the tokens.

constructor.details: Constructs the contract by initializing the immutable state variables, and max approving the Sablier contract.

hasClaimed(uint256).details: Uses a bitmap to save gas.

params.index: The index of the recipient to check.

transferAdmin(address).details: Notes: - Does not revert if the admin is the same. - This function can potentially leave the contract without an admin, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the admin. Requirements: - `msg.sender` must be the contract admin.

params.newAdmin: The address of the new admin.

CANCELABLE().notice: A flag indicating whether the streams can be canceled.

EXPIRATION().notice: The cut-off point for the campaign, as a Unix timestamp. A value of zero means there is no expiration.

MERKLE_ROOT().notice: The root of the Merkle tree used to validate the proofs of inclusion.

TRANSFERABLE().notice: A flag indicating whether the stream NFTs are transferable.

admin().notice: The address of the admin account or contract.

claim(uint256,address,uint128,bytes32[]).notice: Makes the claim by creating a LockupLinear stream to the recipient. A stream NFT is minted to the recipient.

clawback(address,uint128).notice: Claws back the unclaimed tokens from the campaign.

getFirstClaimTime().notice: Returns the timestamp when the first claim is made.

hasClaimed(uint256).notice: Returns a flag indicating whether a claim has been made for a given index.

hasExpired().notice: Returns a flag indicating whether the campaign has expired.

ipfsCID().notice: The content identifier for indexing the campaign on IPFS.

name().notice: Retrieves the name of the campaign.

streamDurations().notice: The total streaming duration of each stream.

transferAdmin(address).notice: Transfers the contract admin to a new address.
